intro: Pentachaeta aurea subsp. allenii, commonly known as the Allen's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow to golden-orange flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include slender stems, linear leaves, and small, daisy-like flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
